result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A D Judkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: $550.00 restitution (includes the 10% surcharge of $50 to DA's office), plus the 5% restitution surcharge of $50.78 to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts. Joint and several restitution with Brian Judkins 22CF144 and Bailey Soper 22CM51.

$265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations. Enroll within 60 days.

Comply with all recommendations of Domestic Abuse Evaluation. 

Must write an apology letter to Amery Community Center and provide it to agent. 

Must complete any other programming required by agent. 

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

Absolute sobriety.

Not to possess or consume drugs without a prescription and only in amount prescribed. No drug paraphernalia. 

No alcohol.

Not to be on the premises of Amery Community Center.

No contact with ZTH or BMS.
Eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation and all restitution/fines/costs are paid. Must petition court.

timeConds.notes: Banked for use by Probation if necessary. Not subject to good time. Subject to work release.

defendant.name: Judkins, Justin A D
defendant.address: 3432 North Star Drive, Eau Claire, WI 54703

records.addlTxt: 22C 003725 Restitution payment to victim
DNA Submission Acknowledgment Form

CASES: 22CF143, 22CM54, 21CM32. 10:51 AM Defendant Justin A D Judkins in court. Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Justin A D Judkins. Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. In 22CF143- count 4- def- G plea. Count 5- def- G plea. Count 6- def- G plea. Count 7- def- G plea. 
CT accepts pleas, adj G. Other counts in 22CF143 are RI&D on state's motion. 21CM32- state is withdrawing motion to revoke DAGP. CT grants state's request to withdraw motion to void DAGP.  22CM54 is RI&D. 
ADA- argument. Atty Taber- argument. Def makes statement. 

SENTENCE: 
Count 4: W/held 2 years probation. 6 months banked jail. Must file request for hearing on any banked jail req within 5 days. Not subj to GT. Subj to WR. 
Count 5: W/held 2 years probation concurrent.
Count 6 and 7: W/held 2 years probation concurrent. 0 days credit. 
Probation conditions on all: Comply with Domestic abuse evaluation.  AS. No drugs without a prescription. No drug para.  No alcohol. AODA and comply. Any other treatment or programming required by agent.  Must write apology letter to community center. Any treatment or programming required by agent. Not to be on premises of Amery Community Center. Not to have contact with ZTH or BMS. Restitution $550.00 includes 10% surcharge to DA. Plus 5% rest surcharge to COCC. Joint/several rest with Brian Judkins 22CF144 and Bailey Soper 22CM51. $265.60 fine/costs, $200 DNA surcharge and sample on each count. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. Must report to probation today by end of day. Elig for expungement if successfully completes all conditions of probation and if all restitution/fines/costs are paid. PCR. 11:24 am adj.
filed by atty Taber

Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. CH - Clerk Atty Taber states matters are resolved. CT. sets plea/sentencing. Bond cont. 10:18 am adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Justin A D Judkins. Def waives PH. CT accepts waiver. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. ARGN. Reading waived, plea NG. Defense is preserved 15 days on prearraignment rights. Bond cont. 11;35 pm adj.
Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
